column2: VIRGINIA DMV PRACTICE TEST
column6: VA

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text
column8: Answer3 Text

column2: 1. This road sign is:
column6: a regulatory sign.
column8: a warning sign.

column2: 2. This sign indicates the _______________ vehicles can safely travel in this area.
column6: minimum speed
column8: maximum speed

column2: 3. This warning sign:
column4: provides advance notice to upcoming speed limit change.
column6: shows the current speed limit that all vehicles traveling in the direction of the arrow must not exceed.
column8: indicates the suggested highest safe speed.
column10: tells drivers that the minimum safe speed is 45 MPH.

column2: 4. This sign warns of a ________ ahead.
column6: hill
column8: no passing zone

column2: 5. This road sign means:
column6: Do not enter
column8: You must come to a complete stop
column10: Slow down, stop if necessary and yield the right-of-way

column2: 6. This road sign means:
column6: Parking spaces are reserved for people with disabled parking permits
column8: Traffic must turn in the direction of the arrow
column10: Lanes are reserved for carpool vehicles

column2: 7. This signal means:
column6: Stop
column8: Slow down

column2: 8. This sign means:
column4: the road may be slippery when wet.
column6: no turns are allowed on this road.
column8: narrow road ahead.

column2: 9. This road sign means:
column6: No right turn
column8: Low clearance
column10: Yield the right-of-way to oncoming vehicles

column2: 10. This sign means:
column4: The divided highway on which drivers are traveling ends ahead.
column6: A road crosses the main highway ahead.
column8: Drivers are coming to a point where another traffic lane joins the one they are on.

column2: 11. If you are involved in a crash, you must:
column4: report the crash to the police.
column6: notify your insurance company immediately.
column8: stop as close to the scene of the crash as possible without blocking traffic.

column2: 12. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.
column6: try pumping it to increase pressure.
column8: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.

column2: 13. On interstate highways in designated rural areas the speed limit is:
column6: 70 MPH
column8: 65 MPH

column2: 14. Parking is not allowed:
column6: in an intersection, unless permitted by signs.
column8: within 250 feet of a traffic light.
column10: within 300 feet of a pedestrian safety area.

column2: 15. Alcohol:
column4: makes you less aware of what is happening to your driving abilities.
column6: makes it easier to make correct decisions.
column8: enhances your ability to see clearly.

column2: 16. Drivers should be aware that a motorcyclist may:
column4: move to the center of the lane on steel deck bridges.
column6: quickly change speed or lane position.
column8: decrease speed and rise off the seat when approaching a railroad crossing.

column2: 17. Following another vehicle too closely is known as:
column6: closetailing.
column8: aggressive driving.

column2: 18. When driving near light rail vehicles, drivers should:
column4: expect trains on any track at any time.
column6: never drive around lowered crossing gates.
column8: always obey signs and traffic signals.

column2: 19. A driver who approaches an intersection:
column4: must yield the right-of-way to traffic already in the intersection.
column6: must drive straight through the intersection, even if another vehicle is already in the intersection.
column8: has the right-of-way over traffic already in the intersection.

column2: 20. You should increase your following distance when:
column4: driving behind a large vehicle that blocks your vision.
column6: exiting a freeway.
column8: following a motorcycle.

column2: 21. A common mistake that drivers make is driving without adequate rest.
column6: False

column2: 22. The driver is responsible for:
column4: making sure that children are properly secured.
column6: ensuring that the vehicle he/she is driving is in good working order.
column8: merging safely when two lanes of traffic moving in the same direction are about to become one.

column2: 23. What should you do if your headlights suddenly go out?
column4: Use your emergency lights, parking lights or directional signals.
column6: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: Ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column10: Brake immediately and activate your emergency lights.

column2: 24. When children are close, what should you do before you back out of a driveway?
column4: Look through your back window for children.
column6: Get out of the car and check behind the car.
column8: Rely on your mirrors.

column2: 25. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
column6: After the crosswalk.
column8: On the crosswalk.

column2: 26. What can you do to prevent skids on snow and ice?
column4: Allow the wheels to keep turning.
column6: Decrease pressure on the brake pedal if your wheels begin to lock.
column8: Brake early and gently.

column2: 27. You reach an intersection that is not controlled at the same time as a driver on your right, and both of you prepare to go straight. Who has the right-of-way?
column6: The other driver.
column8: You.

column2: 28. To reduce their chances of colliding with an animal, drivers should:
column4: Slow down when approaching animals that are standing near the road.
column6: look well down the road and far off to each side.
column8: scan the sides of the road to watch for the reflection of vehicle headlights in the eyes of animals.

column2: 29. When getting ready to change lanes, you should:
column6: check your side view mirror.
column8: quickly turn your head to check for other vehicles.

column2: 30. A broken yellow line alongside a solid yellow line means:
column4: Passing on the right is permitted in either direction
column6: Passing is not permitted in either direction
column8: Passing is permitted on the side of the solid yellow line
column10: Passing is permitted on the side of the broken yellow line

column2: 31. After you stop for a school bus, you must:
column6: pass the bus before the red lights stop flashing.
column8: wait until the red lights stop flashing.

column2: 32. Never make a U-turn from:
column6: the left part of the lane nearest to the centerline of the roadway.
column8: the left lane.

column2: 33. What should you do in case of a steering failure?
column6: Pump your gas pedal a few times to increase the pressure.
column8: Call an ambulance.
column10: Don't panic. Turn on your emergency lights to let other drivers know you are having car problems. Move toward the side of the road and bring the car to a gradual stop.

column2: 34. Two drivers reach an uncontrolled intersection at the same time. Who has the right of way?
column6: The driver on the right.
column8: The driver on the left.
column10: The driver who does not control the car.

column2: 35. DMV's vision standards include _____ or better in one or both eyes.
36. Blind spots are:
column6: At night, the darkest areas of a road, where emergency flashers should be used.
column8: Areas to the side or rear of a vehicle that the driver cannot see with use of mirrors.
column10: Dangerous intersection where the maximum speed limit is 15 MPH or less.

column2: 37. The following symptoms are associated with drowsy driving:
column4: Your eyes go out of focus by themselves.
column6: You continue to yawn.
column8: You don’t remember driving the last few miles.

column2: 38. Blind spots around a large vehicle are _________________ than the blind spots around a car.
column6: narrower and shorter
column8: larger and deeper

column2: 39. Passing is prohibited:
column6: at intersections.
column8: at railroad crossings.

column2: 40. You hear a siren close by but can not see where the emergency vehicle is. What do you do?
column4: Stop only if you are sure that the vehicle is headed toward you in the opposite lane.
column6: Stop immediately and activate your emergency flashers.
column8: Keep driving until you are sure the emergency vehicle is headed toward you.
column10: Pull over to the right side of the road and stop until you are sure the emergency vehicle is not headed toward you.
